Pontiac.Summit Place Mall: Summit Place Mall, originally Pontiac Mall, was a shopping mall serving the city of Pontiac, Michigan, United States. Opened in 1962 as the first enclosed mall in the state, it was built on a 74-acre (30 ha) site located in Waterford Township. After expansions in 1987 and 1993, it featured more than 1,400,000 square feet (130,000 m2) of retail space.
